book.title: Andean Magmatism and Its Tectonic Setting

citation.journal: Geological Society of America Special Papers
citation.title: Petrologic and tectonic evolution of the Cenozoic volcanism in the Bolivian western Andes

wikipedia.title: Cerro Pumiri
wikipedia.summary: The volcano is formed from two volcanic cones. The younger of which may be of Holocene age and is constructed in the middle of a caldera marked by a semilunar shape.

wikipedia.title: Cerro Capurata
wikipedia.summary: Cerro Capurata, also known as Elena Capurata, is a stratovolcano in the Andes of Bolivia and Chile.

wikipedia.title: Isluga
wikipedia.summary: Isluga is a stratovolcano located in Colchane, 7 km west of the Chile/Bolivia border and at the west end of a group of volcanoes lined up in an east-west direction, which also includes the volcanoes Cabaray and Tata Sabaya.

wikipedia.title: Alto Toroni
wikipedia.summary: Alto Toroni (Cerro Sillajguay) is a mountain in South America. It is tall and sits on the international border between Bolivia and Chile.

wikipedia.title: Cerro Cañapa
wikipedia.summary: Cerro Cañapa is an elongated mountain in Bolivia close to the border with Chile. Note that the international border in this area is a straight line that runs from Cerro Araral to Ollagüe, leaving Cerro Cañapa completely in Bolivian territory.

wikipedia.title: Parinacota (volcano)
wikipedia.summary: Parinacota (in Hispanicized spelling), Parina Quta or Parinaquta is a massive dormant stratovolcano on the border of Chile and Bolivia.
